net.sf.jguiraffe.gui.platform.swing.builder.window

Class WindowListenerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jguiraffe.gui.platform.swing.builder.window.WindowListenerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, WindowListener

    public class WindowListenerImpl
extends Object
implements WindowListener

    A mock implementation of the WindowListener interface.

    This class is used to test adapters for platform specific window listeners. It can be configured with the expected number of invocations for the single event listener methods and with the expected source window. After the test the check() method can be used to find out if the expectations are met. If the number of calls of a certain type should not be checked, it can be set to a value less zero.

    Version:
    $Id: WindowListenerImpl.java 205 2012-01-29 18:29:57Z oheger $
    Author:
    Oliver Heger

    • Method Detail

      • getExpectedCalls

        public Integer getExpectedCalls(WindowEvent.Type type)
        Returns the expected number of calls for the specified event type.
        Parameters:
        type - the event type
        Returns:
        the expected number of calls for events of this type (null means undefined)

      • setExpectedCalls

        public void setExpectedCalls(WindowEvent.Type type,
                             Integer calls)
        Sets the expected number of calls for the specified event type. The integer value can be null meaning that the number does not matter.
        Parameters:
        type - the event type
        calls - the expected number of calls for events of this type

      • getCalls

        public int getCalls(WindowEvent.Type type)
        Returns the current number of event calls received for the specified type.
        Parameters:
        type - the event type
        Returns:
        the number of calls received for this event type

      • getExpectedWindow

        public Window getExpectedWindow()
        Returns the expected window.
        Returns:
        the expected window

      • setExpectedWindow

        public void setExpectedWindow(Window expectedWindow)
        Sets the expected window. If a value different from null is set, received events are checked for this source window.
        Parameters:
        expectedWindow - the expected window

      • getExpectedSource

        public Object getExpectedSource()
        Returns the expected event source.
        Returns:
        the expected event source

      • setExpectedSource

        public void setExpectedSource(Object expectedSource)
        Sets the expected event source. If a value different from null is set, received events are checked for this source.
        Parameters:
        expectedSource - the expected event source

      • check

        public void check()
        Checks if the expectations are met. This method should be called at the end of a test case. It compares the expected data with the real figures. If a difference is found, an error is thrown.

      • test

        public boolean test()
        Tests if all expectations are met. Works similar to check(), but does not throw an exception.
        Returns:
        a flag if the expectations are met

      • waitForExpectations

        public void waitForExpectations(long millis)
        Waits a certain amount of milliseconds for the expectations to be met. This is useful because events may come in asynchronously. After the thread has waited for the specified amount of time, the check() method will be called (which will cause a failure if expectations are still not met).
        Parameters:
        millis - the amount of milliseconds to wait

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the current numbers and counters. This is a short cut for reset(true);.

      • reset

        public void reset(boolean check)
        Resets the current numbers of events and the expected counters. Depending on the check parameter the expected counters are set to 0 (if check is true) or to null (which means "don't care").
        Parameters:
        check - the check flag

      • checkEvent

        protected void checkEvent(WindowEvent event,
                          WindowEvent.Type type)
        Checks the specified window event and records this invocation. The properties of the event can also be tested.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to check
        type - the expected event type
